08 days/07 nights TRANQUIL TASMANIA Self-Drive

•

Day 01 - Arrive Launceston - Cradle Mountain (Driving time 2 hrs 14 mins)
Welcome to Tasmania; On arrival at the Launceston Airport drive to Cradle Mountain and check into Cradle Mountain Lodge (Pencil Pine Cabins) and enjoy the evening at leisure.

•

Day 02 – Cradle Mountain
Morning breakfast and set out to explore Cradle Mountain on your own; to begin with walk around the area covering excellent walks such as the Dove Lake Loop Track takes you through the stunning Ballroom Forest, the Weindorfers Forest walk or walk through Cradle valley and its surrounding where you can see many Aboriginal living area and sites. Also a must see is Australia’s premier producer of award winning Cheddar style cheeses, Ashgrove Cheese. With viewing of the cheese making and tastings of the full Ashgrove Cheese range, the Ashgrove Cheese Shop is one of Tasmania’s must see tourist attractions. Return to your lodge

•

Day 03 - Cradle Mountain - Wine Glass Bay (Driving time 4 hrs 30 mins); overnight at Freycinet Lodge (Freycinet Cabin)

•

Day 04 - Wine Glass Bay; experience the tranquility of Tasmania’s Freycinet Peninsula on a journey, The Wineglass Bay Cruise transports you from the gentle coves of Coles Bay along the Freycinet coast to one of the world’s best beaches at Wineglass Bay. Overnight at Freycinet Lodge

•

Day 05 - Wine Glass Bay - Hobart (Driving time 2 hrs 45 mins) Check-in Henry Jones Art Hotel (Standard Rooms) and enjoy the rest of the day at leisure. Recommendation for evening is to explore Salamanca Place or Cascade Brewery - Australia's oldest brewery.

•

Day 06 - Hobart - Port Arthur – Hobart
Post breakfast proceed on an excursion to Port Arthur; after a guided tour, enjoy a harbour cruise on the serene lake and return

•

Day 07 - Hobart – Huon Valley – Hobart
A simple 20 minute drive to Huon Valley is a world of extensive and serene waterways, wild coastlines, quiet farmlands, boutique vineyards, and rugged but accessible World Heritage wilderness. Savor the fresh produce of the land and sea and explore the galleries and studios of artists and craftspeople, where beautiful things are made from paint, clay, glass and fragrant Huon pine. Explore the region on your own today

•

Day 08 - Hobart Depart
Drop off your rental vehicle and proceed to board the return flight

09 days/08 nights of luxurious Sydney, Melbourne and surrounds

•

03 nights Sydney & 05 nights Melbourne and Surrounds

•

Day 01 - Arrive at Sydney and explore the city evening

•

Day 02 - Enjoy a day trip to Blue Mountains and Australian Wildlife including Cable Car Sydney.
Discover Leura village, stop by at Echo Point and see the Three Sisters rock formation and hear the ancient Aboriginal legends. Arrive at Scenic World and join the optional Blue Mountain rides – Scenic Railway, Cableway or Skyway. These rides are a great way to see the steep valleys and canyons.Enjoy a short stop at Narrowneck and Cahill Lookouts for lovely mountain scenery. In the afternoon a chance to see cuddly koalas, kangaroos, wombats, dingoes and fairy penguins. Last stop - Homebush Bay, the venue of the Sydney 2000 Olympic Games and return to Sydney while enjoying a cruise along the Parramatta River (own expense) or return by couch.

•

Day 03 - City Sights, Harbour Lunch Cruise covering the most iconic structures and weave your way through the beautiful northern beach suburbs of Sydney
Sydney Harbour Bridge, Milsons Point, Opera House, Arabanoo Lookout; Manly Beach; followed by Captain Cook Lunch Cruise, SEA LIFE Sydney Aquarium - a journey through 14 newly-themed areas including Tropical Bay of Rays, Discovery Rockpool, Mangrove Swamps, South Coast Shipwreck, a new ocean tunnel walk-through, Shark Valley and Shark Walk, WILD LIFE Sydney Zoo - Get up close to koalas, walk amongst kangaroos and wallabies and come eye-to eye with Rex - one of the world’s biggest crocodiles! With a host of other unique and legendary animals, including the wombat, cassowary and others WILD LIFE Sydney is THE Australian animal adventure, all conveniently located in the heart of Sydney city’s beautiful Darling Harbour. Return to the hotel.

•

On Day 04 - Take a flight from Sydney to Melbourne and proceed to pick up your rental car Driving down to Morning peninsula

•

Day 05 - Enjoy the Mornington Peninsula Attraction Pass, ideal for self-drive itineraries to get the most of your trip at a great value Ashcombe Maze and Lavender Gardens, Moonlit Sanctuary, Cape Schanck Lighthouse

•

Day 06 - Mornington Peninsula – Ferry from Sorrento to Queenscliff – Warrnambool
Drive down to Sorrento ferry terminal, board your ferry to Queencliff & enjoy the most scenic ride in the world - the drive on Great Ocean Road, indulge in range of outdoor activities such as surfing, scuba diving and sea kayaking to arts, cultural and heritage attractions, admire the stunning coastline on the Great Ocean Walk and fine dining, local winemakers and fresh produce along the way, indulge in some relaxation therapy at an invigorating day spa or shop for local delicacies, surfing gear and collectibles, join a tour group and see the famous 12 Apostles or take a self-guided drive along the spectacular Great Ocean Road. later drive to Warrnambool - this evening you can enjoy the Shipwrecked - a state of the art Sound and Laser Show (At own expense) Or just relax

•

Day 07 - Warrnambool – Melbourne
Proceed to Melbourne by car; On route you can visit Ballarat Sovereign Hill (at own expense) Evening free to enjoy

•

Day 08 - enjoy the city and later proceed to Eureka Skydeck 88

•

Day 09 – Depart to airport to catch you return flight

18 days/17 nights in the Lap of Australian luxury!

•

04 night stay in Melbourne

•

02 nights stay in Sydney

•

02 nights stay in Wolgan Valley

•

02 nights stay at Qualia, Hamilton Island

•

07 nights stay in Queensland

•

Day 01 - arrive Melbourne and check-in to The Lyall Hotel & Spa Cruise through Princes Bridge, Botanic Gardens, Herring Island, National Tennis Centre, Melbourne Cricket Ground, Olympic Park and Victorian Arts Centre, visit Eureka Sky Deck with Edge Experience (own expense)

•

Day 02 - embark on ultimate sports lover tour
Exploring Flemington Race Course, home of the Melbourne Cup - the horse race that stops the nation. Drive through the Commonwealth Games Athletes Village on the F1 Melbourne Grand Prix Circuit. Tour the Melbourne Cricket Ground and Rod Laver Arena at Melbourne & Olympic Parks and National Sports Museum, enjoy lunch overlooking the arena at Etihad Stadium, evening, enjoy The Iconic, Colonial Tram Car Dinner, 4 Time Winner of Australia Tourism Award "Best Tourist Restaurant"

•

Day 03 - Drive to Daylesford, A Regional Food Mecca, at Lake House Daylesford (Waterfront Suite)
Experience The Lake House, take a Cooking Class, try their Award Winning Restaurant, Visit Alan’s Studio, try the Various Signature Spa Treatments at Salus Spa or walk through the 6 Acres of Manicured Gardens, blood on the southern cross show, at Sovereign Hill, 40 Minutes drive from Daylesford, offers visitors a taste of 1850's life on the Victorian Gold Fields

•

Day 04 - enjoy a special treat today, a 60 Minute La Gaia Balance Facial at Hepburn Bath House & Spa, nestled in the Mineral Springs Reserve near Hepburn Springs and Daylesford, it draws mineral waters directly from the springs offering unique spa and bathhouse experience. Enjoy the rest of the day at leisure.

•

Day 05 - Melbourne to Sydney; check-in Quay West Suites, Sydney (1 Bedroom Harbour View Suite). Enjoy Harbor Bridge Twilight climb, a 3 and a Half Hour Activity

•

Day 06 - A unique and probably once in a lifetime experience awaits you
- Experience 1: Sydney Opera House Backstage tour, Breakfast in the Green Room and a 30 Minute Sea Plane ride
- Experience 2: Private Surfing Lessons at Bondi Beach
Also included is a Combination 3 Ticket, allowing access to some of Sydney's top attractions such as Sydney Tower Eye, Sydney Aquarium and Madame Tussauds

•

Day 07 - Depart to Wolgan Valley Resort & Spa, Blue Mountain, (Heritage Suite) in a private 4WD vehicle passing through quaint old villages and apple orchards, stopping at Australia's most elevated botanical gardens at Mount Tomah, pass through the townships of Bell and Lithgow before heading east and entering the Wolgan Valley

•

Day 08 - Enjoy a range of experiences such as Timeless Spa, Horse Riding, Nature Based Activities, 4 Wheel drives, Nature walks, heritage interpretive tours, Exploring the Vast Wilderness. Those who appreciate history, will love to stroll through the original 1832 settler farmhouse, meticulously restored

•

Day 09 - Helicopter to Mascot heliport, transfer to Sydney Airport, flight to Hamilton Island, at Qualia, Hamilton Island, Leeward Pavilion Room. On the secluded northern most tip of Hamilton Island, on the edge of the GREAT BARRIER REEF, lies the Crown Jewel of the Whitsundays, QUALIA

•

Day 10 - experience some water sports such as Paddle boarding, Sailing, Boating, tingling the senses at Spa Qualia, get access to Hamilton Island Golf Club or just relaxing on the sundrenched paradise, taking in the incredible beauty of the Great Barrier Reef

•

Day 11 - Flight from Hamilton to Brisbane and Drive to Spicers Peak Lodge, Maryvale, ( 1 Bedroom Lodge) and enjoy range of experiences including exploring the Wilderness, rainforest Bushwalk, mountain biking adventures, Wine Tasting at Granite Belt wine Region, expansive sightings of rare and threatened birds like Glossy Black Cockatoo, Eastern Bristlebird, Regent Honeyeater

•

Day 12 - Free day to spend as you like, exploring the beautiful surroundings

•

Day 13 - Drive to Gold Coast - Palazzo Versace, Gold Coast (Spa Suite) nestled between the Pacific Ocean and the Gold Coast Broadwater; encompasses The Beauty, The Luxury and The Opulence for which the name VERSACE is famous for, Home to 3 award Winning Restaurants, Famed Day Spa, Fitness and Wellbeing centre, Private Marina, Versace Boutique and access to Australia's first water salon poolside Cabana Experience. In the mood of Spooky Humor – Visit Dracula's Cabaret Restaurant enter via Dracula's ghost train ride into the 'Theatre of the Vampire' where three course dinner features the best fresh Australian produce, served with flair and madness.
Drive back to Palazzo, or if feeling lucky, visit the Casino at Jupiter’s Hotel

•

Day 14 - drive to DREAMWORLD, a world class Theme Park, with a ticket covering all rides, Shows and attractions. Also Visit Skypoint Observation deck for Expansive 360 Degree Views of the Gold Coast Shoreline & Skyline

•

Day 15 - gear up for some action-packed adventure and Enjoy Hot Air Ballooning with Vineyard Breakfast; Broadwater Adventure with Paradise Jet Boating combining exciting 360 degree spins, high speed slides and drifts, beach buzzing and heart racing nose-offs in as little as 10cm of water, from the sand-bars of Southport, past the Mansions of Sovereign Island through the Mangrove channels of the Aldershots and along the secluded beaches of South Stradbroke Island. It's more than just a Thrill Ride, it's an Adventure. Spend the rest of the day as you like at Gold Coast where you are spoilt for Choice

•

Day 16 - Gold Coast- Australia Zoo - Spicers Clovelly Estate, Montville (Luxury Spa Suite); drive to a lasting Legacy of the legendary Steve Irwin, The Australia Zoo home to over a 1000 Animals, including Elephants , Koalas, Tigers, Wombats, Emus, Kangaroos and massive Salt Water Crocodiles. Later Bliss at SPA ANISE, Well Stocked Library, Terraced Rose Gardens overlooking the Rolling Green Hills, Picnic Spots overlooking the beautiful Lake Baroon

•

Day 17 - Lay back and enjoy a Parisian Style Breakfast and a free day to Explore the Estate, delightful villages of Montville, Buzzing Coastal Hub of Noosa again spoilt for Choice. Indulge your taste buds in In-house restaurant, THE LONG APRON, serves exquisite French inspired food in an elegant dining room, highlighted by polished Timber Floors and stunning French Doors leading to an outside Courtyard Ideal for Al fresco dining

•

Day 18 - Breakfast at Clovelly and time to end this dream sojourn; Check out and drive to Brisbane Airport, about 90 Minutes away, return the Rental car and continue home mulling over a more than lifetimes memories
